#summary Definition of DiffGram
#labels Phase-Design

= Introduction =

A DiffGram is an XML format that is used to identify current and original versions of data elements.  Microsoft was a specific definition of what a [DiffGram http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms172088(VS.71).aspx] means with regards to Datasets.  

I am using the meaning to imply my own specific version of a diffgram as the differences between database schemas as represented via the SST XML format.

= Details =

Here is a small part of a sample of the SST diffgram:
